title: --dev.period seems to ignore non-0 values
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.10.17-stable-25c9b49f
OS & Version: Linux


#### Expected behaviour
setting --dev.period to a number greater than 0 should cause blocks to be mined continuously, even if a transaction isn't submitted/pending

#### Actual behaviour
Same as `--dev.period 0`: blocks are only mined on-demand. Normal "sealing paused while waiting for transactions" log message as when the value is 0 or omitted from the invocation.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I invoke `geth` from a systemd service file with the following command:

`geth --dev --dev.period 14 --datadir /chaindata/dev/ --http --http.addr 192.168.10.210 --http.vhosts geth.private --http.port 9545 --http.corsdomain "http://remix.private"`

No blocks are added after this point, unless I perform a transaction.

` --dev.period value    Block period to use in developer mode (0 = mine only if transaction pending)`

I'm assuming from this reading that the intended behavior is that blocks appear on a delay based on the number entered.

Even if the intended behavior is that the block production stops when there aren't pending transactions, and a delay is merely simulated, I'm not seeing that happen either:

No delay is observed.

You are using an existing data directory. That will already contain a genesis json specifying the Clique period. You can't change it on the fly. You'll need to start a network from zero if you ant to change the parameters.

E.g. Without a datadir it works fine for me: `geth --dev --dev.period 14`, so the issue is not the period flag, rather it's conflicting with your existing chain.

Thank you.

I feel this should be made more obvious in the `--help` blurb for `--dev.period`. As a user I rely on the documentation to guide me, and this nuance wasn't listed anywhere. Perhaps the binary should log something to the effect of 

`Dev Period not applied because provided value is in conflict with genesis block. Delete data directory contents to apply a new value`
